comments.body: I think this reference might be the one causing a problem. Does the title need to be in quotes? Is the `[online]` bit standard?
Also seems to be different indentation in the two references, but I don't think that should matter.
Might have been spacing, or the `[Online]`?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +237,241 @@        References
        ----------
        .. [1] Matsumoto, M, Generating multiple disjoint streams of
           pseudorandom number sequences.  Accessed on: May 6, 2020.
           http://www.math.sci.hiroshima-u.ac.jp/~m-mat/MT/JUMP/

comments.body: I suspect that the the title should be in quotes, but I don't know if that makes a difference. I'm not familiar with the citation format we use. @mattip @rkern thoughts?
This may be related to regexp for renaming references in numpydoc... looking into it now

hmm doesn't seem like it, at least not a problem with the section I looked at: 

https://github.com/numpy/numpydoc/blob/b4c5fd17e2b85c2416a5e586933eee353b58bf7c/numpydoc/numpydoc.py#L43-L67
